This Airbnb home was ideal for our family trip. There was ample space to spread out inside and to play outside. We stayed at the end of November, so when it snowed there was play space for kids inside. The home was well accomodated for preparing meals and doing laundry as needed. We'll definately consider coming back here again when we need another home away from home stay in the Zanesville/Dresden area.

Fabulous house and a great stay! Everything we needed and more. The owners were incredibly friendly, responsive, and accommodating, and they truly did a nice job renovating. I especially appreciated the minimalistic decor since we were traveling with a toddler. The split level design with a side entry into the basement area was incredibly convenient for us to come in and drop our gear and muddy shoes and had plenty of storage and space to spread out. Good water pressure in the showers. Washer and dryer available. Comfortable beds. Warm, clean, comfortable carpet. Linens and towels available, but perhaps bring your own blanket and extra pillows. I picked up a blanket at Walmart in town. Be aware if you're sensitive to dry heat from forced air, you may want to bring a humidifier. Luckily we had one that we shared with our toddler, but you could also pick one up at Walmart. Lovely yard and fire pit. Great midwestern sunset skies. If you've never been to Zanesville, keep in mind this is a remote area, so although convenience stores like Walmart and restaurants are within driving distance (about 15-20 min), you can't just run down to the corner store if you need something quick, so gather what you need in town while you're there. Also there is no cell service at the house, but great WiFi so that your phone will work fine once you connect. We brought two baby gates for the stairs. It would be great if the owner could invest in a couple inexpensive ones so that guests don't have to travel with them. A minor safety concern was addressed with the owner, and he responded promptly to address it right away. Also, many thanks to the owner for offering us an early check-in which helped us to flex our travel plans to best suit our toddler on a long drive. Wish we could have stayed longer, but we will be back next year!

Upon first arrival, we were provided the incorrect code. Thankfully, I was able to get in touch with the on-site contact to get the correct code. It was gauge inconvenience and I had no cell service at the house. When we finally got in, it was not clean. It’s surprising that it wasn’t clean since check-in was at 1 and we got in at 5. We got ahold of the host and explained our issue. The host did make it right. They drove down cleaned and made the beds within 1-1 1/2 hours cleaning. They did provide plastic plates/bowls/cups for our stay. That was a nice touch so we didn’t have to clean anything. However, none of the heavy bedding was cleaned and on the bed. Very disappointing to deal with this during a pandemic.

clean, accurate description, would definitely stay again

Great place! Very happy with my weekend experience

Cute house in the woods. This house was as described, clean and cute. Lots of bunnies and birds around the house and saw all sorts of wildlife on the drive there, deer, fox, raccoons, etc. It is definitely out in the woods on gravel drive with few houses around so while it’s quiet it is definitely outside of the suburbs and a bit of a hike to town so bring what you need like coffee/creamer etc. My only concern which others should be aware of is a slight smell of cigarette smoke. I assume this is from previous owners so in the walls of the house and certainly not on any bedding or furniture, as I said it’s very clean, but it is there for those of us who are sensitive to smells be aware. My dad could not smell it but me and my sister who have mild allergies did notice it. Otherwise all was as stated, we never needed to bother the manager. No cable but access to all apps with a Smart TV and WiFi worked fine. Gameroom in basement was fun and great for kids. Tip: Donald’s Donuts was great stop for breakfast.

The property is very remote and quiet. We really enjoyed the big yard and fire pit. The house is finished well and had plenty of room for us to sleep. What a relaxing time!

Exactly as advertised! Perfect get away spot, secluded property with a fire pit (not sure if the fire pit was listed). The house was very clean and the communication between the rental company was great. We will definitelybe going back sometime!

Loved the cleanliness and little details make the feel of house very urban. We all loved it, specially the available foosball and other games. Beautiful patio and lots of sun. Very well maintained property. Host Raymond was super-responsive and accommodating too. Will definitely come back.

Very clean and comfortable home. Plenty of space for our family. Very kid friendly! Would highly recommend it. Close to amenities while still be in the country and having some space to yourself. Owner was very quick to reply with questions or concerns we had.

We loved how this place was a bit more secluded, it made for a quiet experience. The place was clean and our kids enjoyed the Fussball table and we liked having access to a washer/dryer during our stay. We were there with lots of snow/ice, we would love to see it in the summer. Communication was great via text and Raymond was very accommodating to any needs/questions we had. I suggest bringing your own food to cook in the kitchen. Downtown and grocery stores were about 19 minutes away and easy to find. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a getaway or staying in the area. 5 ⭐️’s!

This silo is clean, spacious and a short drive to the Columbus Zoo and The Wilds. A very unique experience staying in a structure that housed grain in a beautiful outdoor setting. However, it was difficult to rest peacefully at night with only the two french doors as a possible escape in the event of fire. Having just experienced a house fire in our family and being accompanied on this trip by a lifetime firefighter we were concerned with the lack of windows in the silo, especially to provide an escape from the second floor. After a search we were only able to locate one smoke detector on the first floor. Windows and additional smoke detectors would make this stay fantastic.

Mark's Unique Kabin is exactly that, unique! Whether your party is large or small, likes nature or would rather shop & see the sites, you will be comfortable and have fun! The cabin is quiet, spacious, clean, & well stocked (from bedding to spices & cooking staples, to dishes & cookware, to info on local eateries, stores, & sites). For nature lovers, you are practically in Dillon State Park. A barred owl sat right above us one night - very cool! Zanesville and Newark offer many sites & shops.

Owners were fantastic, house was fantastic. I was notified a couple days before we arrived that the house was on a well. We had solid water pressure Friday night, Saturday and Sunday was a struggle. Saturday morning we had no water for most of the day, contacted Mark, we advised where the reset was for the well tank. Had to hit the reset every time we used the restroom, at times had to wait to use the restroom because there was no water. Only 2 times during the weekend I was able to get the water pressure to the 50 psi Mark recommended, both times was at 3am. Most of the time the psi was around 30, but it did not last long. Couldn’t really shower so we let our wives take showers. Mark told us about a cabin they have not too far from the house that has a shower, my brother in law tried it but for the amount of money paid, no one should have had to walk to a cabin to shower.
Great!

Well stocked, we enjoyed the game room. Comfortable beds, easy to adjust temperature. The location is very nice and quiet. When you stay in a silo, remember you won’t generally have windows. The doors on the bottom floor let good in light in, however. I would recommend!

Our boys thought it was a super cool place as well. Beds were comfortable and there was plenty of space! Would def recommend!

This was a very nice space. And fun! My family enjoyed the foosball table especially, and everything we needed was readily available, no need to ask questions which was nice. I did have a rough night sleeping becuase the upstairs of the cabin was uncomfortably hot. The ventilation didnt seem to wprk as well up there. But the space was clean and quiet and quirky. We had fun.
A very unique experience. Thoughtful design and helpful amenities that made for an enjoyable stay.

The place was absolutely beautiful. very clean and fresh smelling . we are from NY and my boyfriends sons live in Ohio they come out for a cookout and enjoyed the fire pit. The big boys really enjoyed the pool table. The place is actually a lot bigger than it looks. We were absolutely amazed on the whole concept of a grain bin turned into such a beautiful place. Very clean and tidy, it felt like a brand new house! Well built and appointed, hominess in every nook and cranny. Thank you!
Adorable cabin! Super spacious and had lots to do. Location was peaceful and beautiful. Host had lots of recommendations. Would gladly stay again
Excellent place to stay for our purpose, and for an excellent price!!

We were amazed at the transformation of the corn bin into a stunningly beautiful home. They have created a peaceful, welcoming haven that provides everything you could possibly want for a truly memorable stay. We were only able to stay one night but the nearby town of Zanesville satisfied both the history buff and outdoor explorer parts of our souls. We would stay at Unique Kabin in the Woods again in a heart beat!

Perfect place to stay at with all the amenities we needed, and very comfortable. The only criticism I have is against myself, for not staying longer! Nice quiet surroundings close to nature, and great story to tell our friends that we slept in a corn crib :-)

Truly a great space in a beautiful location with loads of great personal touches that make a stay extra special with lots of snacks, spices, condiments, soaps, and shampoos, etc, etc. The building is such a cool conversation piece but the inside is, as others have said, incredibly spacious on each floor. This is a very creative guest house. Loved the concept for the most part, although I was not aware that I would have zero cell service. I'm sure this is due to the nature of the structure. It is very rural, as Mark describes. Very quiet!
The house was great one of the best I ever been in
Came here for my birthday and it was peaceful and quiet... Mark was really nice and responded quickly.... I love the pool table and the yard... will definitely come back
Great stay
What a lovely stay! We were shocked at how big the place was. Beautiful surroundings. We especially enjoyed sitting on the porch and watching a thunderstorm. We will be back!
Really enjoyed the stay, the house was very clean, it was a great deal compared to local hotels

mark and his wife are amazing people, very easy to get along with. their home was spot on for anyone who wants to get away from the city life. the home had plenty of space! they was amazing hosts.
